facts: Traffic lights are timed and sometimes use sensors in the road to change faster when cars are waiting.
A bicycle can be one of the most energy-efficient ways to travel because it uses human power directly.
Airplane cabins are pressurized so passengers can breathe comfortably even when flying at high altitudes.
Trains can carry many people at once, which often makes them more fuel-efficient per passenger than cars.
Roundabouts can reduce serious crashes because cars move in the same direction and usually at lower speeds.
Electric cars can use regenerative braking to turn some braking energy back into electricity for the battery.
Shipping containers are built to standard sizes so they can move easily between ships, trains, and trucks.
